Former first friend MySpace. Retired ü§ìüòÅ People keep asking: yes, these are my photos. New blog:

posts.description: Someone reminded me today that several weeks ago I said I felt like I was having the most amazing time of my life--that every day was better than the day before. Today he asked me "Was today the best day of your life so far?" You know what? It probably was! My joy comes from the exploration of endless possibility and that I know I'm helping others. I truly helped someone today. There's no better feeling. Your life's path may not be obvious or predictable, you may not know where it leads, but I think you will know when you have found a path that is truly your own. üòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅ

Some people will tell you that Waikiki is too crowded. I won't. There's a place for crowds and Waikiki is an awesome one. I love watching the tourists ooh and awe at the ocean and it has some of the best beginner surf spots in the world. I just started to learn to surf this year. Here's a scene from Waikiki ... I should take more shots of this place, but every time I'm there I'm usually in the water trying to üèÑ surf! Haha üèùüèñ‚õ± Love me some Hawaii :-)

Amazing night as we watched lava flow into the ocean on the Big Island in Hawaii!! üòç I've witnessed a lot of beautiful things in life, this has got to be at the top of your bucket list people, trust me!!
Hawaii is known as the rainbow state üåà and it really earns its reputation. You see these just about anywhere you go -- it's a daily occurrence. üå¥üíïü§ôüèº

I love seeing untouched places like this. It leads your mind back to what life was like on the islands before people came. The waterfalls were stunningly tall -- this shot is from a helicopter. I think Hawaii has some of the best helicopter tours in the world. The mountains are like nothing you've ever seen... especially on Kauai :-)

Ok, so this is not Hawaii :-) I'm pulling this one out of the archives--it was taken at the lantern festival in Chiang Mai, Thailand. It was a really special night for me and brings back tremendous memories. That's what photos do best, don't they?

Night adventure on Oahu.  That's a lighthouse off in the distance.  Everything was all fine and dandy hanging out there in the dark until we heard a gigantic monster-like roar. It turned out to be a Hawaiian monk seal laying on the beach!
Mountains of Oahu are underrated and incredible üòÅ
Good morning from Oahu. The short hike to this waterfall is one of the hidden treasures from my favorite Hawaiian island. üòÅ

One of my Hawaiian besties told me that seeing a "Honu" or Turtles is good luck and brings long life! True? I captured this with my underwater housing on the first try! I'd call that good luck for sure!! Working on the long life!

I arrived on Oahu this morning. Beautiful Hawaii! Looks peaceful and calm huh? A few years ago, I was in a Kayak on the West Side looking to photograph some dolphins when a crazy storm blew in out of nowhere. Within minutes me and @john_hook and @themarinamiller and her son were so far out to sea we had to get picked up by a boat! That day we were not the only ones. Several people had to get rescued all over the island! Such a scary reminder that you can't predict nature's power. üòÇ
On the road back from Abraham Lake. Canada is so beautiful üòÅ

The best sunrise I've ever witnessed!! When you spend all your time taking landscape photographs, you are truly dependent on nature. The weather dictates all.  For weather geeks, the conditions you‚Äôre looking for are somewhat predictable, but never certain. You learn to read the sky. You look and make educated guesses. You put yourself in the prime spot and wait. You‚Äôre prepared for that moment that is always singular, always unique. No two sunrises are ever the same. You hope for the best, and pray for serendipity. When Planet Earth is on your side, magic happens. Taking a good photograph begets joy & serenity in a meditative state. You become one with the universe, because the universe is on your side. Everything that was before this moment had to be, or this moment would not be. The cosmos are telling you, once and for all, that your place is in this world, and here is your reward. 
Check the link in my bio: I just launched a blog where you can see the full photo uncropped: myspacetom.com
posts.localization: Torres del Paine National Park, Patagonia, Chile

posts.description: Beautiful night in üá≠üá∞ Hong Kong üá≠üá∞ Such an incredible skyline and so many places to shoot it from. Visit soon - you will not be disappointed !!

What's your favorite Ferris wheel?  I shot this in Sydney, Australia -- Luna Park. Seeing so many Coachella Ferris Wheel pics, I thought I'd pull this one out of the archive. The original Ferris wheel was built in America as an answer to France's Eiffel Tower. George Ferris, a civil engineer from Illinois invented the Ferris wheel in the 1890's for the Chicago World's Fair!

Sometimes I wonder if the mystery of travel, discovery and exploration has been tainted by the Internet‚Äîthese days it‚Äôs almost hard not to see photos of nearly every place multiple times before you go there! This place was different for me. I was traveling through Taiwan with no real idea of what I might find. I got a rental car in the main city Taipei and just started driving. After a few days I‚Äôd entered the gorge by car, but later moved to hiking on foot. This was not a touristy or popular spot.  At least not in 2012 when this photo was taken. As I meandered along the mountain‚Äôs edge trail, pushing bushes out of the way to take in the view, I rounded a corner and saw this temple peering out from the fog. I felt a strange combination of excitement and serenity. I need more moments like this. :-)

Hong Kong üá≠üá∞ is such a vibrant city. Camera in hand, there's almost too much to photograph. You can't help but feel energized by the frenetic pace of people movement, the impressive architecture, and the scenic (especially at night) harbor. I've seen old photos of Hong Kong and oh how I wish I was there 150 years ago. Back then you'd see the original Junks with their distinctive red sails. The one pictured here is a replica of the old days üòÄüåÉüõ≥
